intro: Hylaeaicum levianum, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silvery-white layer of wax. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its water-storing tissues, it is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
